alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 19 at 9:18PM PST until February 22 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TUESDAY TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TUESDAY TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow possible above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with up to 12 inches at higher elevations. For the Winter Weather Advisory at elevations between 1500 feet and 2000 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph, strongest Tuesday afternoon. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County, including the communities of Happy Camp, Scott Bar, and Highway 96 west of Klamath River. * WHEN...From 10 AM Tuesday to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels drop to ground level Tuesday evening. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
